Generalized inverse logit function

Source: R/logit.R
inv_logit.Rd

Compute generalized inverse logit function.

inv_logit(x, min = 0, max = 1)

Arguments

x

value(s) to be transformed
min

Lower end of logit interval
max

Upper end of logit interval

Value

y Transformed value(s).

Details

The generalized inverse logit function takes values on [-Inf,Inf] and transforms them to span [min, max] : $$y = p' (max-min) + min$$ $$where$$ $$p =\frac{exp(x)}{(1+exp(x))}$$

Author

Gregory R. Warnes <greg@warnes.net>

Examples

x <- seq(0,10, by=0.25)
xt <- jSDM::logit(x, min=0, max=10)
cbind(x,xt)

#>           x         xt
#>  [1,]  0.00       -Inf
#>  [2,]  0.25 -3.6635616
#>  [3,]  0.50 -2.9444390
#>  [4,]  0.75 -2.5123056
#>  [5,]  1.00 -2.1972246

y <- jSDM::inv_logit(xt, min=0, max=10)
cbind(x,xt,y)
